name: Camp Inc.
tag_list: overnight-camp, camp, accelerator, incubator, jewish, teenager, entrepreneurship, business, school, philanthropy, non-profit, community, team-building
overview:
Camp Inc. is a specialty overnight camp run by the Boulder JCC that provides 7th to 12th grade campers with an entrepreneurial focused summer camp experience rooted in Jewish values.

Camp Inc. will offer (3) two-week sessions and will have its first summer of campers in the summer of 2014. The camp was recently funded through the Foundation for Jewish Camp’s incubator II with support from the Jim Joseph Foundation and the Avi Chai Foundation.

Campers live on the University of Boulder campus and spend 2 weeks learning about entrepreneurship, business, philanthropy, community, team building, Israel and Jewish values all through whole person learning and hands on experiences within Boulder’s start-up community. Mentors will engage the campers with activities on a daily basis allowing campers to implement the concepts into an industry of their choice.

The director, Josh Pierce, is a serial entrepreneur from Denver who buily and sold the award winning event production company Dance Trax Entertainment, Inc. and more recently founded TAGster, Inc.

Boulder JCC wins grant for business ‘Camp, Inc.’
